content.p: Head, Centre for English Language and Foundation Education, Faculty of Social Sciences Saleha Abdul Rahman's academic career spans three decades. She has been teaching academic English and study skills to university students and trained both government and corporate personnel in communication and delivery skills. Besides English language & linguistics related modules, she also teaches critical thinking and basic principles in applied psychology at the University of Nottingham in Malaysia. Her areas of interest are critical thinking dispositions and reflective practice to support learning & personal growth. Saleha is currently the Head of the Centre for English Language & Foundation Education at Nottingham University in Malaysia Jalan Broga, 43500 Semenyih Selangor Darul Ehsan Malaysia University of Nottingham Malaysia DULN001(B) telephone: +6 03 8924 8000 fax: +6 03 8924 8005 course enquiries: +6 03 8924 8686 Monday - Saturday 9:00am - 5:30pm (Except on public holidays)
